description.narrative: Enhanced understanding and collective action coalesced around 1) how digital technologies can enhance democratic institutions, processes and practice and 2) how a multi-stakeholder approach can strengthen democratic norms in the digital era, focused on global South
FL §06.33.01.11 Other Kinds of Cooperation with NGOs

title.narrative: Support alignment of the conference activities and year of action target outputs with the multilateral and global digital cooperation processes especially related to the UN Roadmap for Digital Cooperation and the UN Secretary General Common Agenda
Alignment of the conference activities with global processes around digital cooperation.

target.value: 1. Number of interviews and consultations conducted with key stakeholders: Minimum of 6 2. Number of support activities for multi-stakeholder process conducted (including communications, Webinars, thought leadership pieces): 2 3. Speakers from the broader UN digital cooperation ecosystem invited: Minimum of 2 4. Collection of data inputs supported, as relevant 5. Support to action coalition provided: 1 - including public co-leadership and communications, and at least 1 global advocacy activity such as workshop, report, online consultation, or roundtable delivered (target output format to be discussed and aligned with MFA depending on the coalition of action in scope).

title.narrative: Support alignment of the conference activities and year of action target outputs with the multilateral and global digital cooperation processes especially related to the UN Roadmap for Digital Cooperation and the UN Secretary General Common Agenda

1. Number of Southern think-tanks/research entities contributing substantive inputs. 2. Number of country-level multi-stakeholder pilot programming initiatives, anchored in broad-based inclusive consultations. 3. Number of young people involved in online e-consultation and in-person focus group discussions. 4. Number of people from traditionally excluded groups participating at the conference (virtually or in-person).

target.value:
1. 15 2. 3 3. 500 4. 50
Experience and perspectives from the Global South would be systematically brought in via targeted and facilitated consultations and the voices and needs from the traditionally excluded groups will be heard.

title.narrative:
Provision of conference venue for two conferences in the UN City Copenhagen including logistical support, five satellite events and int’l travel arrangements for up to 17 people from the Global South
Support to project management + communication and dissemination of project outcomes.

1. Number of participants participating in the hybrid kick off conference, including satellite events.
2. Number of participants participating in the high-level conference, including satellite events.
3. Number of key stakeholders receiving the communications material and conference outcomes document(s).

target.value:
1. 250 2. 350 3. 700
The conference successfully delivered with sufficient participation (including from traditionally excluded groups and from the Global South), and awareness of follow-on actions.

title.narrative:
Enhanced understanding and collective action coalesced around two main areas, including:
i) How digital technologies can enhance democratic institutions, processes and practice, including through support to new forms of deliberative and participatory democratic mechanisms and their integration into established democratic processes.
i) How a multi-stakeholder approach could strengthen democratic norms in the digital era by identifying strategies to contribute to closing the digital divide (including inclusion and access), build digital capacities, ensure human rights and security online and promote responsible digital technologies.

Concrete and practical solutions and strategies provided for how digital technologies can be deployed in a responsible and inclusive way, to enhance democratic processes, including through a multi-stakeholder approach.

target.value:
Activities carried out (as outlined in outputs below) in support of the two Tech for Democracy conferences (as well as pre- and post-conference processes).
An aligned set of concrete actions and next steps to guide the rollout of a multi-stakeholder platform/process on the interaction between technology and democracy.
